title: Experiential Property
description:
Experiential Property (21021). 1 unit, credit/fail. Students will participate in appellate advocacy simulations (including oral arguments) for some of the cases assigned in the basic property course. These simulations will take place as part of the basic property class. Roughly one-quarter of the cases covered in property will be initially presented to the entire property class by brief (10 minute) oral arguments of students in the experiential property class. Students in experiential property will also meet over lunch on Thursdays to debrief about the in-class oral arguments. If you are a JD student who is currently enrolled in the 4-credit Property course (LAW 21017), you also have the option to enroll for a fifth credit in “Experiential Property.” The 4-credit Property course will be graded on an H/P/LP basis, while the Experiential Property will be graded on a CR/F basis. Open only to JD students who are concurrently enrolled in LAW 21017-01. I. Ayres.

Course Selection: If you are interested in taking “Experiential Property,” please email Judith.calvert@yale.edu and she will enroll you.
